revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/2601:8A:4101:28D0:44B5:C015:A6F4:A623|2601:8A:4101:28D0:44B5:C015:A6F4:A623]] ([[User talk:2601:8A:4101:28D0:44B5:C015:A6F4:A623|talk]]) to last version by Bkonrad
revision.text:
{{Wiktionary}} '''Abduction''' may refer to: {{tocright}}
==Of a person or people== * [[Alien abduction]], memories of being taken by apparently nonhuman entities from a different planet * [[Bride kidnapping]], a practice in which a man abducts the woman he wishes to marry * [[Child abduction]], the abduction or kidnapping of a young child (or baby) by an older person * [[Express kidnapping]], a method of abduction where a small ransom that a company or family can easily pay is requested * [[International child abduction]] * [[Kidnapping]], the taking away of a person against the person's will * [[Raptio]], large scale abduction of women, either for marriage or enslavement * [[Tiger kidnapping]], taking a hostage to force a loved one or associate of the victim to do something
==Sciences== * [[Abduction (anatomy)]], a type of movement which draws a structure or limb away from the median plane of the body * [[Abductive reasoning]], a method of reasoning in logic
==Media==
===Film and television=== * [[Abduction (1975 film)|''Abduction'' (1975 film)]], directed by Joseph Zito * ''Abduction'' (1997 film), directed by Takao Okawara * [[Abduction (2011 film)|''Abduction'' (2011 film)]], directed by John Singleton * [[Abduction (2019 film)|''Abduction'' (2019 film)]], directed by Ernie Barbarash * "Abduction," [[List of Death Note episodes#ep27|episode of ''Death Note'']], a Japanese animation television series * ''[[Abduction: The Megumi Yokota Story]]'', a 2005 American documentary film * [[Abduction (The Outer Limits)|"Abduction" (''The Outer Limits'')]], a 2001 television episode * "Abductions" (''[[Totally Spies!]]''), a 2002 episode of an animated television series * ''The Abduction'', a 1996 TV movie starring [[Victoria Principal]] and Robert Hays * [[The Abduction (Alias)|"The Abduction" (''Alias'')]], a 2002 television episode * [[The Abduction (Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman)|"The Abduction" (''Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman'')]], a 1994 television episode
===Literature=== * [[Abduction (novel)|''Abduction'' (novel)]], a 2000 novel by novelist Robin Cook * ''[[Abduction!]]'', a 2004 novel by Peg Kehret * ''The Abduction'', a 1987 novel (Norwegian title ''Bortf√∏relsen''), written in Norwegian by [[Mette Newth]] and translated into English by Steven T. Murray and Tiina Nunnally * ''The Abduction'', a 1998 novel by [[J. Robert King]] set in the Forgotten Realms of Dungeons & Dragons
===Music=== * Abduction, a music label run by members of [[Sun City Girls]] * [[Abduction (song)|"Abduction"]], a 2005 song by Iron Maiden vocalist Bruce Dickinson * ''[[The Abduction from the Seraglio]]'', an opera by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart * ''[[The Abduction of Figaro]]'', a musical pastiche by Peter Schickele writing as P.D.Q. Bach
==See also== * [[Abducted (disambiguation)]] * [[Abductor (disambiguation)]]
{{disambiguation}}
